title: Are Americans obsessed with education? - Quora
tags: Education in the United States of America
Culture of the United States of America

response.answer_text: Yes. We somehow believe that education is the single most important factor in life success. That’s wrong. There ARE studies which show ON AVERAGE that college grads earn more than non-grads. However, college grads generally come from more well-to-do socio-economic backgrounds…and there’s more correlation between background and income than college graduation and income. What we forget is that ALL education can do is lay a foundation of (a) general skills for studying and exploring and/or (b) a foundation of knowledge in a field. Success requires that students know how to apply those foundations in order to succeed. Far too many students graduate from college believing they have all they need. Fortunately, I had a boss my first job out of college who observed one “we didn’t hire you because you know anything…we hired you because you’re trainable. So go learn stuff.” It was the best advice and kicked off a superb career. What about credentials? We are a credentials obsessed society — sadly. However, the pendulum is swinging. Companies as large as Google are realizing that job descriptions mandating credentials don’t often get the right person for the job. So they are beginning to reduce the need for credentials and look for other ways to evaluate potential employees. The scoop seems to be: We need a strong education system to establish a foundation on which the nation succeeds economically.BUT, that is only a start. We need a culture which acknowledges the weakness of education and the need for a wide range of individuals who are exceptionally motivated, explorers, great with detail, etc…School does not today prepare you for the future because it has become more and more focused on preparing you for tomorrow.To have students prepared for the future, their ability to explore new things is far more important than anything else.Only when we make this adjustment will we be prepared for the future.

not obsessed with education, just obsessed with the result of being educated. being educated is about knowing….. the opposite of NOT knowing. Knowing things, many things, can improve your quality of life, the opposite of this is ignorance, NOT knowing things can be very dangerous, very detrimental to a happy, healthy life. Americans are obsessed with happy and healthy, not all of them but lots of them.

Education is not an obsession, but a necessity for all human beings. Why would anyone ask this? It looks like you aren’t too concerned about your education, as you don’t know a plural (Americans) from a possessive or contraction with “is” (American’s).

Not obsessed enough as there are thousands of jobs going begging because people are not qualified to do them. Ours is a credential driven society from the end of public school onward and technology and society are changing so fast education and reeeducation on a continuing basis is a must to stay current in ones profession.

Teacher unions have done an excellent job of spinning the need for education. There are two types of education, primary and secondary. Americans have been convinced that the only way to success is secondary education and college degrees. The result is trillions in debt, millions with degrees that are valueless and constant pressure to spend more. You tell me if that is an obsession or an actual requirement. To me the answer is crystal clear.
